comment: There is a lot of busy work. Her D2L is confusing and a bit unclear. Weekly team leader and team recorder responsibilities. The smallest tasks are tedious when trying to figure out where to submit and what specifics she wants added. Weekly meetings online for 1.5 hr

Be prepared to give up your weekends! Your tests are open from 11:30am Friday to 11:30am Saturday. EVERY SINGLE WEEKEND you must meet via video chat with your group either Saturday or Sunday for 90-120 minutes!! She has a million and 15 assignments and the course is extremely hard to navigate through. Instructions are very hard to find.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: This class is all team work. Blackboard discussions that are required weekly along with discussion question, assignments and quizzes. I took this course over the summer, and it was tough to do. Maybe it would be a little easier if you took in the fall semester. Better be a good writer takes off points for the smallest writing errors.

Hey Guys,  Literally, I have never written a review for a professor, but I encourage you to stay FAR away from this class. The whole semester is group projects, and if your group feels you didn't contribute enough, you will fail or make a D. A D does not count for credit. Take anyone else. ANYONE.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Never seen anything like it. Impossibly complicated course design requiring students to monitor course activity 7 days a week. Due dates for assignments occur every 48 hours. 90 minute group webcam session required during the work week. This class is not appropriate for distance learning students requiring flexibility to balance work and school!!

Her book is essential to passing. Syllabus is misleading, outlines major requirements but doesn't include EVERYTHING she wants from you, including the recorded wkly Group mtgs (not graded, but mandatory) The coursework was overwhelming, more like 2 classes instead of 1. Tons of WEEKLY assignments! Stay far far away, take someone else!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Lots of pointless busy work. You are required to meet every week with your group for at least 1.5 hours sometimes longer. Quizzes, assignments (more than multiple classes put together) Very Unorganized. The directions for each assignment are so vague and hard to understand. Tough grader. This one class will have the workload of 3 classes combined.

The most demanding course I've ever taken. A HUGE group project all semester long, you take turns being leader, must complete the assignment for your week, quizzes every week, must meet online for 2 hours each week w/ group, 3 feedback essays and 6 peer evaluations. SO many assignments. Finding the info for assignments is impossible. Unorganized.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Run away. Run far away. She is a tough grader and there is no actual organization to her class. I follow her intructions carefully (that's IF you can find them at all) & barely make Bs... WAY too much work for an online class. You might as well take it on campus cause she makes you meet with your group weekly anyways. Worst class I've ever taken.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: This class is the hardest but best class I have taken at KSU. She teaches upperclassmen so she does grade accordingly. If you listen and care about the work, you will learn a lot of information that will benefit you during and after college. Take the time to follow the directions. If you cannot work in a team, do not take this class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Be prepared to research the entire syllabus, the D2L website, the emails and every post in the forums to find an answer or to get directions.  Projects are filled with tedious and mundane steps that must be followed.  Otherwise, prepare to lose lots of points.  This class will dominate your life, and not in a good way.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: The class is a little confusing starting out but if you hang in there, you will find it is actually an enjoyable class. You work in a team the whole semester and it requires you to do more than the regular boring research paper group projects. Dr. Roebuck wants to see her students do well and truly cares. Effort is expected as it should be.
Class contained allot of work, but lessoned were learned with all exercises. I see other comments. All have to understand this is a credentialed MBA course and MBAs are not for all.

Just read her syllabus and decided to drop the class. Says you must schedule a webcam team meeting once a week between 11:30 Wednesday and 11:30 Friday. Teams will consist of 5-6 members. I wanted an online class for flexibility. I only have a few waking hours available during that time period and can't be sure that my group can comply with those.

This Lady Is Insane.  I have been in her class for 2 days and the very first assignment is a syllabus "scavenger hunt" after spending over an hour and reading the whole syllabus I received a 70 on the assignment because many answers were unclear and some no where to be found.  I will drop this class and recommend you don't even try.

A terrible class with loads of busy work.  Extreme grammar checking-turn on advanced proofing options in Word and check everything.  Instructions are extremely long, vague, and contradictory.  Assignments may have pieces located in multiple different folders.  Save the instructions you use and be prepared to argue your grade.

Worked in teams the entire semester & members taught each other - fine, after all this is Managing Organizations. Majority of the time members were confused about what we were doing. She's responsive to emails, but her answers typically left me feeling just as or more confused than before. Also gives zeros for work she considers incomplete.

I'm very disappointed in the quality of instruction and applicable skills that Dr. Roebuck presents to the class (Online MBA.)   The class is not intellectually stimulating and is only difficult due to the sheer amount of busy work.  Dr. Roebuck focuses on out-dated materials such as "how to write a memo" and "how to leave a voice message."
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Terrible teacher, all about group feedback, worse class in my 6 years of school (we are in MBA online program)

Insane amount of busy work to be done in this class. Mandatory weekly webcam meetings. Class is very possible to get an A but you must do in an insane amount of work. If you have other classes to focus on I would not take this class. Only take this class if you can dedicate at least 3 to 5 hours to it a week.

Directions are wordy as possible (20 pgs long) & contradictory. INSANE busy work. Learned barely anything b/c of her obsession with writing skills - you focus more on her PICKY requests than actual content. No organization-look everywhere or you might miss something. Weekly webcam meetings, 20+ pg papers due every 2 wks. SO TIME CONSUMING!!!!!!!!!!
This is by far the worst class I have ever taken. Very unclear, very unorganized, and OH MY GOD THE WORK LOAD IS INSANE. She doesn't seem to care about her students at all. AVOID AT ALL COSTS

Assignments without any help or direction. Many times students will ask her questions, and her response is "Ive answered that before, here's where you can find it". No real guidance or teaching in this class at all. Mandatory 2 hour weekly webcam meetings with a team for a group project that is most of the class. So much for online class flexibiliy

At first, Dr. Roebuck seemed tough. Rather than teach in a traditional sense, she coaches students (even if it's not what they want to hear) and facilitates the course. If you want to learn management "hands-on" and actually take something away from the course, pick her. This course taught me more about management, and myself, than ANY prior class.

Avoid at ALL costs! Her version of communication  as many words as possible. Course is insanely unclear. Directions contradict each other and at times she doesn't even know what needs to be done. INSANE amount of pointless busy work with very tight deadlines for group work. She is a horrible professor who needs to learn managment skills herself.

Worst. Professor. Ever. I took this class online so I can be flexible within my personal schedule. She "teaches" this course as if this is the ONLY course we are taking this semester. Her assignments are pointless, she is rude and picky, and her instructions are vague and unspecific. Do not take MGT 4001 with this professor. She is horrible.

The most unnecessary amount of busy work i have ever been given in any class i have ever taken. She is ridiculous and so is her class. Mandatory group meetings every week, a dreadful team leader evaluation (mine ended up at least 30 pages written), and a project someone in grad school should do. Way too much for an undergrad course. Horrible prof

Stay far away from this class. It is literally so loaded with busy work that you will want to drop out. This class makes me want to drop out. You will be connecting via webcam weekly. Also you have 24 hours to complete the individual test, so if you work/have night classes expect to stay up late to get it completed. Print everything out.

Not hard, but is frustrating. The entire semester is focused on you and the group you are assigned to. Your grade lies in the hands of your group members. My biggest complaint is that she gives you a small window to complete GROUP assignments (24 hours) Words of advice; Check D2L EVERY DAY, read all rubrics thoroughly, and PRAY you get a good group

Stay on top of things, be aware of future assignments and know deadlinesdue dates and you will be fine. Assigned to a group which you are team leader for two weeks which is not difficult if you know what is going on in the class. Hint - follow the syllabus schedule, it's provided for a reason. Grades fair. This class is not that bad.

This is THE worst class I have taken here at KSU. She doesn't teach at all. She makes you get in groups and expects you to teach each other and "manage" for a week. with her in none of it. I really don't think she did anything except assign us team quizzes. The project at the end is killer if you have a bad group. Don't do this to yourself
very busy class, took the mini mester but I learnt a lot. You are better with a good group!
Pray you get a good group.  Mine group gave me a bad review (even though I did a great job) because they wanted to raise their own scores. Bad way to grade because per evaluation is an unfair system.
Mandatory web camera classes each week. 100% group work. Tons of assignments each week that were not very clear and she grades very harshly. If you don't have a lot of time, do not take this class.

I took this class on line.  Be prepared for a lot of work! It is not a hard class. Follow all of her rules, read her directions ask questions, clarify, clarify again. You can make an A. There is a lot of busy work. Pray you get a good group.  Mine was amazing.

I spent 10 hours a week on this class. We had 24 assignments that each took hours. The entire semester was working in a team. She uses the textbook she wrote so you have to memorize the whole book. This is a risky class to take for an elective.

The most busywork I've ever witnessed. This class is more grammar/comp than it is communication. I'm graduating in May with a 3.8 GPA and yet I can't do better than a 70 on her unclear, haphazard assignments. Online class = 2hr mandatory weekly meetings. Awful course, awful Prof. Wish I could drop.

Busy work: 2-3 assignments due per week. Improved written communication skills- This class is a mixture of English 1101 and Communication. Make sure you know all the rules of Appendix A of her book because failure to follow those rules will hurt your grades.Overall, Dr. Roebuck is a good professor. If you are lazy, just sign up for another class.

Managerial Coaching was an excellent class to take in a mini-mester; Dr. Roebuck does a wonderful job of keeping it interesting.  Roebuck makes it the most interactive of any class you'll take at KSU.  The workload is the main drawback... format borders on busywork, at times, but this is a course that helps you beyond just completing an elective!

Dr. Roebuck has a very unique teaching method which includes weekly quizzes - meaning reading of the entire textbook is mandatory. She lets you set the weights on grades (team, individual, etc). This class is fairly labor intensive which is odd for an elective. Do the work and you'll get an A.

This is a business elective course, but don't be fooled.  This is easily the most involved, busywork-loaded class I've had in my entire college career.  There are usually 3-5 assignments due every single week and each requires a good deal of time.  They're not all difficult, but you will put in lot more work than most other classes if you want an A

Professor Roebuck is a great teacher and a really good person. I loved the class and the attention that she gives each student. Professor Roebuck is always willing to help you. The class is a LOT OF WORK but she is very fair!! Love her!!
Good professor. Lots of work but she is very fair.

This is a business communications course, which is an elective. Don't be fooled, this class is no joke... one of the most involved classes I've taken in my entire college career. You participate in group work the entire semester--pray you are placed in a decent group. Heavy workload, but you will learn A TON!
